newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil CVRD to invest 800 mln reais in '97.
newsitem.headline: Brazil CVRD to invest 800 mln reais in '97.

text.p: The chairman of recently-privatized mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (CVRD) said the company's investment in 1997 will be raised to 800 million reais from 600 million reais.
Benjamin Steinbruch told a news conference investment levels would be raised especially in railway and iron ore. The company has two railways.
CVRD is the world's biggest iron ore producer and exporter. It also owns the world's largest iron ore deposit of 18 billion tonnes in the Carajas mining district in Brazil's northern Para state.

Steinbruch, who leads a group of investors who bought a controlling stake in the privatized company in early May, said a model for a new company structure would be ready within 30 days and then discussed by the new controlling shareholders.

The international Valepar consortium led by Steinbruch includes local pension funds, NationsBank Corp, Opportunity Asset Management's offshore investment fund, CVRD employees, the investment arm of Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDESPar) and private steelmaker CSN, of which Steinbruch is chairman.
Steinbruch held the news conference to mark the celebration of CSN's production of 100 million tonnes of steel for the first time in its 51 years of operation.
((-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom 5521 5074151))
